conclusion: Analyze forces to determine initial acceleration of block A.
Two blocks A and B connected by a spring, B on the ground.
Identify forces: Weight of A and B, Spring Force, Applied Force.
System initially at rest, B in contact with ground, spring compressed.
Spring force balances weight of A when at rest.
Initial spring compression \( x_0 \) satisfies \( F_s = k \cdot x_0 = m_A \cdot g \).
Net force on A when force \( F \) is applied: \( F_{\text{net}} = F - m_A \cdot g - k \cdot x_0 \).
Using Newton's second law: \( F_{\text{net}} = m_A \cdot a \).
Simplify expression for initial acceleration: \( a = \frac{F}{m_A} - 2g \).
Final answer: Initial acceleration of A is \( \frac{F}{m_A} - 2g \).
